name: Sally Anderson
description: I am primarily a news/press photographer with many publications in national newspapers and magazines. A selection of these can be found in a gallery on my website. I am an eclectic photographer but I particularly enjoy landscape, wildlife travel and event photography. I have a Licentiate distinction with the Royal Photographic Society. I have a large portfolio of stock images on Alamy.com.

name: Muriel Binnie
description: Muriel Binnie is an abstract landscape photographer using ICM and multiple exposures to capture the essence and mood of a scene. Some colourful iPhone abstracts of every day objects too.

name: David Ferguson
description: Travel has been a long standing passion and, in photography, I look for the opportunity to gain a deeper connection with the places I have the privilege to visit. I enjoy exploring the world so come share my journey through the looking glass. Myfloranova.com was a creative project born out of not being able to travel during the covid lockdowns. Something different and hopefully something that I will get back to work on again one day.

name: Olly Headey
description: Olly is a photographer based in Edinburgh. His work focuses primarily on street photography and travel, where he looks to capture the hidden beauty of daily city life.

name: Joe Houghton
description: Joe Houghton is a photography trainer who offers talks, judging, and online training in photography. He has written 3 books on photography with more in the pipeline.

name: Alan Jones
description: A photographer specialising in wildlife, sport, landscapes, events and street photography – and travel when I can. My type of photography focuses on the world about us – in the moment. What excites me is capturing images which are impossible or very difficult to repeat -"a brief history in time".

name: Peter Paterson
description: I have been doing photography for over 50 years Starting in the Darkroom now fully Digital during this time I have gained several distinctions a Fellowship of the RPS, an MPAGB and a MFIAP.

name: Ian Sommerville
description: I became a photographer through my interests in hill-walking and the outdoors. I'm not a fan of the idea that images should speak for themselves and strongly believe that all images are improved with appropriate commentary.

name: Neil Scott
description: Neil has been a member of EPS since 2006. He used to enter FIAP approved salons leading to his EFIAP/s. He was also elected FRPS in 2012. His main photographic interests are people, especially street photography, and still life/abstract/surreal stuff. His ABC of photography is to Amuse, Bemuse and Confuse.

name: Donald Stirling
description: Recently retired transport consultant with a keen interest in transport photography, particularly railways, buses, trucks and ferries. Membership of the Society has broadened my horizons in terms of genres. Whether my techniques have improved is open to debate!
